In Our Sanitariums 

                                              Letter 79, 1905 
     766. The light given me was that a sanitarium should be established, and that in it drug medication should be discarded, and simple, rational methods of treatment employed for the healing of disease. In this institution people were to be taught how to dress, breathe, and eat properly,--how to prevent sickness by proper habits of living. 
     [SEE ALSO 458]
